weather_report:
As the afternoon settles into Downtown San Francisco, a thick veil of clouds blankets the city, hinting at rain just over the horizon. The atmosphere feels heavy, laden with moisture and a hint of promise as the day edges closer to dusk. Temperatures hover around the low fifties, and a brisk wind rustles through the streets, carrying with it the scent of impending precipitation. Visibility may be somewhat compromised, reflecting a haze typical of this time of year, softened by the shadows of the city’s skyline.

As the skies darken, expect the rain to weave through the neighborhoods before dawn, leaving the ground slick and glistening. For those venturing outside, a sturdy jacket and perhaps a light scarf would provide comfort against the chill of the air, which will drop to the low forties tonight. Engage in cozy indoor pursuits; linger over a warm cup of coffee in a favorite café or visit a local bookshop to get lost in pages while the rain patters softly against the windows. Alternatively, a leisurely stroll with an umbrella might unveil the quiet charm that emerges when the city glistens after rainfall—a perfect backdrop for contemplation or connection, as life moves rhythmically on in this iconic urban landscape.
